md:
giải nghĩa từ "tail" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

* Tail (noun) - Đuôi
	+ Meaning: The back part of an animal, especially when it is long and thin.
	+ Example: The dog wagged its tail with excitement.
	+ Related words: head, body, leg, paw
* Tail (verb) - Theo dõi
	+ Meaning: To follow someone or something closely, often secretly.
	+ Example: The detective tailed the suspect all night.
	+ Related words: follow, track, pursue, stalk
* Tail (noun) - Phần đuôi
	+ Meaning: The last part of something, such as a sentence or a piece of writing.
	+ Example: The tail of the sentence was confusing.
	+ Related words: head, body, beginning, end
* Tail (verb) - Cắt đuôi
	+ Meaning: To cut or shorten the tail of an animal.
	+ Example: The farmer tailed the sheep to make them easier to handle.
	+ Related words: cut, trim, shorten, dock

Note: The meanings and examples provided are just a few of the many possible interpretations of the word "tail".
html:
giải nghĩa từ "tail" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  • Tail (noun) - Đuôi
    • Meaning: The back part of an animal, especially when it is long and thin.
    • Example: The dog wagged its tail with excitement.
    • Related words: head, body, leg, paw
  • Tail (verb) - Theo dõi
    • Meaning: To follow someone or something closely, often secretly.
    • Example: The detective tailed the suspect all night.
    • Related words: follow, track, pursue, stalk
  • Tail (noun) - Phần đuôi
    • Meaning: The last part of something, such as a sentence or a piece of writing.
    • Example: The tail of the sentence was confusing.
    • Related words: head, body, beginning, end
  • Tail (verb) - Cắt đuôi
    • Meaning: To cut or shorten the tail of an animal.
    • Example: The farmer tailed the sheep to make them easier to handle.
    • Related words: cut, trim, shorten, dock

Note: The meanings and examples provided are just a few of the many possible interpretations of the word "tail".
